profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T18:26-0400

did.unittitle: Cosmology of De-ka-na-wi-da's government of the Iroquois confederacy, 1885
did.abstract: This item contains the Dekanawidah myth, lists of chiefs of the League, ceremonial chants (including Condolence Council), constitution and its acceptance (pages 1-200). There is a version of the same in Mohawk, with interlinear translations, names of principal families, and incomplete "aboriginal dictionary." Marginal notes are by William N. Fenton.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Received from William N. Fenton and accessioned, 1949.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This item is also available on microfilm (Film 348).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This item is described by William N. Fenton, "Seth Newhouse's Traditional History and Constitution of the Iroquois Confederacy," American Philosophical Society Proceedings 93 (1949): 141-158.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Seth Newhouse (also known as Da-yo-de-ka-ne Oshweken) was a Mohawk Indian, Six Nation Indian reserve, Grand river, Ontario, Canada.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: From the original formerly in possession of Ray Fadden, St. Regis Mohawk Reservation, Hogansburg, New York; now in possession of Mohawk tribe.
